org.jetel.util

Class DataRecordGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.parser.AbstractParser
      • org.jetel.util.DataRecordGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parser

    public class DataRecordGenerator
extends AbstractParser

    Data records Generator - helper for DataGenerator component

    Generates data records according to pattern. Record fields can be filled by constants, random or sequence values. Created by refactoring DataGenerator component.
    See Also:
    for more info

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataRecordGenerator

        public DataRecordGenerator(Node component,
                   DataRecordMetadata metadata,
                   java.lang.String pattern,
                   java.lang.String randomFields,
                   long randomSeed,
                   java.lang.String sequenceFields,
                   long recordsNumber)
                    throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Parameters:
        component: - instance of component which uses this recordGenerator; May be null if this generator is used without component.
        metadata -
        pattern: - pattern for filling new record. It is string containing values for all fields, which will be not set by random or sequence values. Field's values in this string have to have format coherent with metadata (appropriate length or delimited by appropriate delimiter)
        randomFields: - names of fields to be set by random values (optionaly with ranges) separated by semicolon. When there are not given random ranges (or one of them) there are used minimum possible values for given data field (eg. for LongDataField minimum is Long.MIN_VALUE and maximum Long.MAX_VALUE). Random strings are generated from chars 'a' till 'z'. For numeric fields random ranges are: min value (inclusive) and max value (exclusive), and for byte or string fields random ranges mean minimum and maximum length of field (if it is not fixed), eg. field1=random(0,51) - for numeric field random value from range (0,50], for string field - random string of length 0 till 51 chars, field2=random(10) - allowed only for string or byte field, means length of field
        randomSeed: - Sets the seed of this random number generator using a single long seed.
        sequenceFields: - names of fields to be set by values from sequence (optionaly with sequence name: fieldName=sequenceName) separated by semicolon.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException
        See Also:
        for more info

      • setReleaseDataSource

        public void setReleaseDataSource(boolean releaseInputSource)
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        If releaseInputSource is false, the previous input data source is not released (input stream is not closed). The input data source release is performing into the method 'setDataSource'. Default value is true.
        Specified by:
        setReleaseDataSource in interface Parser
        Overrides:
        setReleaseDataSource in class AbstractParser

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Life-cycle hook. Follows the semantics of Node.postExecute() Called by the owner of the parser after each graph phase execution. NOTE! postExecute should do exactly the same thing as deprecated method reset(). The only advantage over reset() is that it matches with the name of Node's life-cycle method postExecute().
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - Catch-all exception

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Life-cycle hook. Follows the semantics of Node.free() Called by the owner of the parser to release resources when the parser is not needed anymore NOTE! free() should do exactly the same thing as deprecated method close(). The only advantage over close() is that it matches with the name of Node's life-cycle method free().

      • nextL3Source

        public boolean nextL3Source()
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Used to move to the next subsection of an input source where applicable. Example: For XLS files each sheet is considered a separate subsection, upon reaching end of sheet getNext() call returns null, this may be followed by a nextL3Source() call; if the call succeeds reading may continue. Implementation for parsers that do not deal with data inputs with multiple subsections should always return false. Naming explanation: level 1 (L1) - all inputs to be processed, level 2 (L2) - individual inputs in L1, level 3 (L3) - individual subsections in L2.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if no more subsections are available
